statement:
Let $\phi \in L_2(\mathbb{R})$, $\phi_k(x) = \phi(x-k)$ and $\hat{\phi}$
be the Fourier transform of $\phi$. Let $A$ and $B$ be positive
constants. Then the following are equivalent:

1.  $\forall c(k) \in l_2,\ \   A\left\|c\right\|^2_{l_2} \leq
    \left\|\sum_{k\in \mathbb{Z}}c(k)\phi_k\right\|^2\leq
    B\left\|c\right\|^2_{l_2}$

2.  $
    A\leq\sum_{k\in\mathbb{Z}}\left|\hat{\phi}(\omega + 2\pi
    k)\right|^2\leq B$

The first of the above conditions is the definition for
$\{\phi_k\}_{k\in\mathbb{Z}}$ to form a Riesz sequence.
names: equivalent condition for the translates of an $L_2$ function to form a Riesz sequence, an
